title.narrative: Defining Intervention Points for Improving Lao PDR Extension

description.narrative: Approximately 80% of poor people in Laos live in rural areas. Agriculture forms 53% of gross domestic production (GDP), but at least one-third of the population remains below the poverty line. A new Agricultural Development Strategy has been released by the Lao Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (MAF). It outlines a strong role for MAF in facilitating information transfer to farmers through new mechanisms, such as establishing farmer organisations and encouraging private sector partnerships. This small research activity (SRA) will identify ways for MAF to improve current agricultural extension practices in Lao. Australian and Lao extension experts will be consulted through workshops and current extension practices will be reviewed. Successful and unsuccessful ventures will be documented to provide lessons learned. The SRA will deliver a full ACIAR project proposal and/or a stand alone guide defining potential points for future intervention to improve Lao extension. (ASEM/2011/009)
